subject: Web3
title: Stolen Art as NFTs
description: A short lesson to help you apply Stolen Art as NFTs.

hook.text: Artists discovered their work being sold as NFTs â€” by strangers. The blockchain didn't verify who created the art.

buildup.text: Anyone could right-click, save, and mint another artist's work as their own NFT in minutes.

discovery.text: DeviantArt deployed bots to scan marketplaces for stolen art. They found hundreds of thousands of cases.

twist.text: Reporting stolen art was slow and frustrating. Marketplaces had tiny moderation teams for millions of listings.

climax.text: The technology that promised creator empowerment also enabled mass theft of creative work.

punchline.text: NFTs empowered artists. They also empowered art thieves.

quiz.question: What was a major problem with NFT art?
options: Strangers minted and sold other people's art as their own
